metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8767 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer underflow in the olsr_print function in tcpdump 3.9.6 through 4.6.2, when in verbose mode, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted length value in an OLSR frame.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.5.1-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.1-2ubuntu1.1').
